alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 8:37AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, central St. Charles, Orleans and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 900 AM CDT... At 834 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Lake Catherine to St. Rose. Movement was east at 15 mph. Rain amounds of up to one inch in 30 minutes is likely with the stronger storms. HAZARD...Locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Brief very low visibilities and ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Avondale, Metairie, Hahnville, East New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Lake Catherine, Luling, River Ridge, Boutte, Ama, Destrehan, St. Rose and Norco. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 217 and 251. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
